greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Let c=sum_{k>=0} 1/2^(k!), sequence gives values of terms congruent to 5 of the continued fraction for c.
comment: Observation: if b(k) denotes the sequence of all elements of the continued fraction for c, b(k)=4095 if k==6 or 19 (mod 24); b(k)=4722366482869645213695 if k==12 or 37 (mod 48) ...
example: The continued fraction for c is shown in A076157. The "big terms" are all congruent to 5.
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Nov 02 2002
